intro: Salacia dognyensis, commonly known as the African salacia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Saluraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
